content.raw:
I think that gaussian noise is a bad type of noise to add to sensors such as lasers as it creates rare samples outside typical filtering bounds.

We had an awkward situation of this happening just during the VRC: where returns from the hands had noise added to them and appeared ~5cm off of one of the hands - simply because if you sample enough times you get a Gaussian outlier.

I suggest simply clipping the distribution of noise you are adding at ~3 sigma bounds instead.
